name: Memories
description: Listen to previews Symphony Vietnam 1975 and Memories at: http://levankhoa.com/music.html “It is excellent; I think this is Le Van Khoa’s best. The Western Style and pentatonic melodies combine especially well in these pieces. The sound is romantic, fresh and always interesting. The Ukrainian musicians did a fine job of interpretation and played with great skill. They really brought out the moving impressionism and passion of the writing.” - Vicki Riley, Doctor of Applied Music This CD features the music of Vietnamese American composer, Le Van Khoa. His Debut CD entitled “Vietnam 1975” was the first symphonic suite about the Vietnam War. In his second CD, “Memories,” the music is based on memories; fond, bittersweet, but always present. This CD has a mix of piano, violin, cello, flute, and orchestral music. Le Van Khoa – Memories 1. Remembrance (5:17) Piano & Orchestra 2. Nocturne (4:57) Violin & Piano 3. Beautiful Bamboo (4:23) Piano Solo 4. Longing (5:54) Cello & Piano 5. On the Way Home (4:48) Piano Duet 6. Romance (6:43) Piano & Orchestra 7. Song of the Black Horse (1:49) Piano Duet 8. Romance (5:14) Violin & Orchestra 9. In the Moonlight (6:36) Flute & Orchestra 10. Memory (5:40) Cello & Orchestra Music performed by The Kyiv Symphony Orchestra with conductor Alla Kulbaba and award winning soloists, Irina Starodub, Svyatoslava Semchuck, Yuriy Pogoretsky, Ganna Nuzha, Vitaliy Kalitovky, Inna Dovbja, and Lyudmila Chichuck.

name: Symphony Vietnam 1975
description: Listen to previews Symphony Vietnam 1975 and Memories at: http://levankhoa.com/music.html “A flier introducing the Vietnam 1975 Symphony states: ‘The pride of the Vietnamese people after 30 years in exile, the Vietnam 1975 Symphony has arrived.’ I think this is an appropriate way of describing an event that occurred in April 2005. I’m speaking not of a noisy street demonstration, a large gathering, or any of the typical ways in which our people have commemorated April 30, 1975, the day South Vietnam fell to the communists. In past years we have recalled that day with regret and sorrow, but this year, as the flier says, we can feel a sense of pride. True pride, one we all can share, for the deep feelings that all the Vietnamese refugees have held fast inside have been expressed fully through the medium of a serious art form, that of classical Western music, that is, the Vietnam 1975 Symphony by composer Le Van Khoa.” -Pham Phu Minh ( penname Pham Xuan Dai, editor of the monthly 21st Century) This CD features the music of Vietnamese American composer, Le Van Khoa. His Debut CD entitled “Vietnam 1975” was the first symphonic suite about the Vietnam War. In his second CD, “Memories,” the music is based on memories; fond, bittersweet, but always present. This CD, Symphony Vietnam 1975, follows Vietnam before the war, featuring influences by traditional Vietnamese folk songs and traditional Vietnamese instruments like the Monochord and Zither. Symphony Vietnam 1975 was first released on April 30th, 2005 in recognition of the 30 year anniversary of the fall of Saigon. Le Van Khoa – Symphony Vietnam 1975 01. Introduction (6:00 min) 02. Procession (6:30 min) 03. Festival (4:05 min) 04. Full Moon (10:14 min) 05. In the Depth of the Night (9:40 min) 06. On High Sea (10:18 min) 07. Hymn to Freedom (5:43 min) Music performed by The Kyiv Symphony Orchestra with conductor Alla Kulbaba.

name: My Beloved Vietnamese Music Book (2nd Edition)
description:
For Intermediate level Piano

My Beloved Vietnamese Music Book has Vietnamese Pop songs transcribed for the piano.

name: The Beautiful Bamboo
description:
The Beautiful Bamboo is a book for Voice and Piano. This book was commissioned by Golden West College and has a few images of Vietnamese instruments as well as music. Each song has a short description in English under the titles in the book. 

A Collection of Vietnamese Folk Songs and Art Songs compiled, arranged, and composed by Le Van Khoa.

5    Introduction
7    The Beautiful Bamboo - North Vietnamese Folk Song
9    The Flower and the Butterfly - North Vietnamese Folk Song
14  Threading the Needle - North Vietnamese Folk Song
17  Picking Flowers - North Vietnamese Folk Song
20  Cut the Tree to Build a Boat - North Highlander Folk Song
23  Looking for my Lover - Central Vietnamese Folk Song
26  Song of the French Horse - South Central Vietnamese Folk Song
30  Song of the Black Horse - South Vietnamese Folk Song
33  Song of the Starling - South Vietnamese Folk Song
36  In the Evening - South Vietnamese Folk Song
38  To Protect the Roses - South Vietnamese Folk Song
40  Lullaby - South Vietnamese Folk Song
43  I Remember - Art song by Le Van Khoa
50  The Song of Long Ago - Art song by Le Van Khoa
54  Serenade - Art song by Le Van Khoa
61  Sleep, My Dear - Art song by Le Van Khoa
66  Picking Up the Shooting Star - Art song by Vu Thanh
79  The Last Time - Art song by Le Van Khoa

"According to the Vietnamese culture, the bamboo is paralleled to the gentleman. The bamboo grows tall and straight: it wave in the wind but does not bend to it. The its wood is hard yet hollow represents that the gentleman has no ill thought. The bamboo is frail and its gracefulness is compared to a young girl. In reality the bamboo is very useful to the Vietnamese in many ways. Bamboo is used to build houses, walls, fences, tool handles, bridge, tables, chairs, beds, clothe lines, weapons, chopsticks, and even tooth-picks. Rows of bamboo are used as the dividing lines between villages."

"I Remember", and "The Song of Long Ago" have Vietnamese and English lyrics

"The Last Time" has only English Lyrics

Words and Lyrics in this book are all in Vietnamese. English translations of the titles were provided so that others could know what the songs are about.

name: Piano Solo - Advanced With Music CD
description:
Contents:

3    The Dragonfly
8    Evening Breeze
12  Music in the Air
22  In the Pond
30  Cut the Tree to Build a Boat
38  Elegiac
46  A Night in Vietnam

"Each culture as its own special way of expressing feelings through music, feelings such as love and beauty. I'd like to share with you the splendid sound of Vietnamese music, the piano is my instrument of choice. There are a variety of compositions in this book that I wrote in various pentatonic scales. Also there are a couple of compositions with a clear Western influence. Either way, whether Western or Eastern, the flavors have been preserved to enrich one's musical palette."

- Le Van Khoa

This book comes with the new Piano Solo Advanced music CD featuring the songs from this book performed by Lyudmila Chichuck.

name: Remembrance - Piano Solo
description: The song "Remembrance" was in Le Van Khoa's musical CD "Memories" for Piano and Orchestra. This music is a little bit different, having been written specifically for the piano alone.

name: Vietnamese Art Songs
description:
Vietnamese Art Songs is a book for Voice and Piano. All of the piano parts in this book were written by Le Van Khoa, with many of his own original songs as well. 

Goi Nho and Nho Tieng Xua  have Vietnamese and English lyrics

Words and Lyrics in this book are all in Vietnamese. English translations of the titles were provided so that others could know what the songs are about.
